messages.title: This is Your Chance for Change
messages.content: Only Bob Barr and the Liberal Democrats are fighting to give you the final say on the Brexit deal. Don't support Theresa May’s hard Brexit. Oppose hard Brexit to get a final say. Remove party politics from a properly funded NHS. The only way to send the message that Theresa May is taking the country in the wrong direction is to back Bob Barr and the Liberal Democrats here.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Bob Barr will oppose hard Brexit to give you the final say on the Brexit deal, support for business, industry and involved in EU collaborations.
The Liberal Democrats will increase dedicated tax to fund the NHS and support mental health services.
Warrington schools have always been underfunded. Bob Barr will protect headteachers from Conservative cuts.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Right Home in the Right Place
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support for mixed housing developments focused on various socio-economic groups. Additional housing should be on brownfield sites.
Pressing for a dedicated health tax to fund the NHS as much as their European neighbours. Improving mental health services.
Opposing costs of £2 each way to cross the Mersey Bridge. Continuously pressing for full toll removal.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Warrington South was won on a small margin last election. Bob Barr and the Liberal Democrats are best placed to obtain it.

issues.brexitEurope: Oppose hard Brexit and support EU collaborations.
issues.economy: The local economy includes over 900 Warrington based companies employing over 19,000 jobs and skilled manufacturing sector.
issues.education: Opposing school cuts and protecting headteachers from Conservative cuts.
issues.environment: Support for mixed housing developments including brownfield sites instead of green belt.
issues.health: The Liberal Democrats have been pressing to bring healthcare up to par with European standards, including a dedicated health tax.
issues.labourEmployment: Approaches to build local job creation through businesses based in Warrington.
issues.transport: Opposition to toll costs of the new Mersey Bridge.

community.content: Support for mixed housing developments focused on various socio-economic groups. Building additional housing on brownfield sites.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have lived in the constituency for nearly 75 years. As councillor, I have a track record of raising important local issues and representing residents.

politicalExperience.achievements: Raising important local issues and representing residents.

contactInformation.address: FREEPOST RRLH-LUHT-KYCT, Liberal Democrats, Freepost RRLH-LUHT-KYCT, 35 Dale Street, WA1 2AR

images.caption: Bob Barr with local residents and supporters.
